intro: Heleniastrum rivulare, commonly known as the stream helene, is a flowering plant native to the wetlands and stream banks of eastern North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and thrives in partially shaded to full sun conditions. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators. Heleniastrum rivulare is often found in association with other wetland plants, contributing to the biodiversity of riparian ecosystems.
